elements.title: Claude Hayes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Claude Hayes ran away to sea in the 1860s before beginning his career as a landscape painter (painting pictured)?

elements.title: an activist remotely projected anti-CCP slogans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an activist remotely projected anti-CCP slogans onto a building in Chongqing University Town in August 2025?

elements.title: Amon G. Carter Jr. (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Amon G. Carter Jr. worked as a newspaper salesman as a child, despite his father being a successful businessman?

elements.title: Best of Wives and Best of Women (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the title of "Best of Wives and Best of Women" in Hamilton came directly from Alexander's farewell letter to Eliza before his fatal duel with Aaron Burr?

elements.title: Meitetsu Nagoya Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "DJ booths" are used for announcements at the Meitetsu Nagoya Station?

elements.title: Mark Aldridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, in a civil case between Mark Aldridge and a shop owner, South Australia's district court found that a person can be liable for the defamatory comments of others on their social media posts?

elements.title: St. Francis Seminary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tom Cruise attended St. Francis Seminary, a Catholic high-school seminary run by the Franciscan Order?

elements.title: a song about her fiancé's penis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Taylor Swift recently released a song about her fiancé's penis?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
